bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Libeoffice/ooimpress does not play embedded videos properly anymore. When using GNome with XOrg, videos are played full screen, regardless of the size of the object in the presentation file; when using GNome with Wayland, ooimpress just crashes.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
libreoffice-impress-5.2.3.3-11.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a blank presentation 2. Add a video 3. Start slideshow
Actual results: Incorrect video size/crash
Expected results: Video should play on top of the slide.
Additional info:
I'll add a dependency on the magic component we need to make this work out of the box. I guess it got moved around packages at some point or something cause it used to work out of the box

No, gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-gtk was not installed. I had:
gstreamer-0.10.36-15.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-devel-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-libav-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-bad-freeworld-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-base-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-base-devel-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-good-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-ugly-1.10.2-1.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-ffmpeg-0.10.13-16.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-bad-free-0.10.23-35.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-base-0.10.36-15.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-espeak-0.4.0-9.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-good-0.10.31-17.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-ugly-0.10.19-19.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-python-0.10.22-11.fc25.x86_64 gstreamer-tools-0.10.36-15.fc25.x86_64
Installing gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-gtk seems to solve the problem indeed.
libreoffice-5.2.5.1-6.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-67de7bdb10

libreoffice-5.2.5.1-6.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-67de7bdb10
libreoffice-5.2.5.1-6.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
